./.title: Introduction
./.body:
Introduction to Bella
Bella is programming language built on top of .NET Framework. Bella code is transpiled by source-to-source compiler into C#. Generated code is WCF application.
Why Bella?
Bella facilitates rapid development of solutions based on SOA architecture.

You could define business logic in a simple and lightweight manner. So, language simplicity reduces number of potential errors.
You don't need to worry about transactional scopes and how you persist the data.
It is easy to write cross-component code. Contracts are shared in mono repository and you don't need to care about contract versioning and regeneration.

Bella Compiler
Bella compiler is proprietary program of HYS-Enterprise.

You should request bella compiler from your point of contact. Note, that bella compiler should contain generic config templates in order to make it work with bella-code-generator


Powered by gitbook, provided by alexey.nikiforov.

bella-project-structure.html.title: Bella Project Structure
bella-project-structure.html.body:
Bella Project Structure ðŸ“‚

./Components - C# components.
./Domain - Bella components.
common - shared logic and contracts.
formulas - shared formulas.
model - shared models.
services - public contracts.
/.api.bs - describes public contract of service in component.


DomainError.bs - shared enum for errors.
busConfig.json - Kompass config. Component communication based on Message Queues.


/Bella - bella compiler. ðŸ› 
/ - root folder of \ component.
model - aliases, models.
services - implementations of services (e.g. \, \Async)
ApiConfig.bs - API config.
PersistentObjects.bs - registration of persistent objects.
Services.bs - describes component communications.

syntax/bella-services.html.title: Services
syntax/bella-services.html.body:
Services [bella.core.communication.services]
Services allow components to communicate:

Bella component sends message to CSharp component via WCF
Bella component puts message for another Bella component into Queue via Kompass

Host services
You define services in /services/Services.bs by convention.
external service  on 
hosted service  on 

serviceName - name of a service defined in ./Domain/common/services.
communication - [serviceName | Kompass | [externalComponentName]]

Example:
hosted service HelloWorld on HelloWorld
external service Greeter on [GreeterCSharp]

In order to spin up component services (APIs), you have to define them in /services/ApiConfig.bs
Example:
setting StartupServices:String = "HelloWorld:HelloWorld;Greeter:[Kompass]"

Share services
In order to share a service with other components you should register it in ./Domain/common/services
Create file with the name of component of defined service and add public contract to be consumed by other components:
service HelloWorld
    SayHello() oneway
service Greeter
    Greet(CustomGreeting):Reply

syntax/bella-data-types.html.title: Data Types
syntax/bella-data-types.html.body:
Data Types [bella.core.datatypes]

Data Types [bella.core.datatypes]
Primitives
String [bella.core.models.string]
Date & Date Time [bella.core.models.dates]
Enums & Errors


Aliases [bella.core.models.alias]
Objects [bella.core.models.object]
Casting
Object initializers
Auto-calculated fields


Arrays [bella.core.collections.array]
Access element by index
Mutate array
Traverse


Dictionaries / Maps [bella.core.collections.dictionary]
Mutate dictionary


Models / Contracts



Primitives
Bella has limited amount of standard primitives that you could work with:

String
Boolean
Integer
Number
Date
DateTime
Enum/Errors

String [bella.core.models.string]
Strings are enclosed in double quotes. "Bella is awesome"
You could concatenate string with "+" operator: LogInfo("Hello" + Name)
Date & Date Time [bella.core.models.dates]
Date is initialized like this: Date(, , ).You could cast Date to DateTime: Date(, , ) as DateTime
Enums & Errors
Errors are define in ./Domain/common/DomainError.bs
enum DomainError
    DomainError = 1
    CustomError = 2

Throw errors: error[CustomError] ""
You could define your own enum:
enum WeekDay
    Monday
    Tuesday
    Wednesday
    Thursday
    Friday
    Saturday
    Sunday

Use it like this: WeekDay..
Aliases [bella.core.models.alias]
It is not common to define variable of type in Bella. Instead, we use aliases.
Bella alias is a type and variable at the same type.
object HelloWorldMessageId:String
object CreatedOn:DateTime

Now you can use it to define other objects.
But, if you want to define scoped varialbe inside some procedure you could use let keyword: let MyHelloWorldMessage = 
Objects [bella.core.models.object]
You could define your own Objects. Fields are indented and look like this: : .
object HelloWorldMessage
    messageId: HelloWorldMessageId //object fields
    createdOn: CreatedOn

Casting
Cast objects via as operator. BaseMessage as HelloWorldMessage
Also, you could check object type via is operator.
Object initializers
let MyHelloWorldMessage = new HelloWorldMessage(
    messageId = "STRING_LITERAL",
    createdOn = now // DateTime.now literal
  )
// initialize arrays
List()

You could initialize default objects and collections via new keyword. Also, Bella has empty keyword (kind like null).
Auto-calculated fields
Arrays [bella.core.collections.array]
object HelloWorldMessagesList:HelloWorldMessage[*]
                

Access element by index
Not possible in Bella, :P.
Mutate array
   ++=  // adds item
   --=  // removes item by reference*

Traverse
foreach HelloWorldMessage in HelloWorldMessagesList
  LogInfo(")

Dictionaries / Maps [bella.core.collections.dictionary]
object HelloWorldMessageDictionary:HelloWorldMessage[HelloWorldMessageId]
                                  

Mutate dictionary
  [] =  //adds item
   --=  //removes item

Models / Contracts
It is good practice to separate domain models from contract/transport models.
Domain models are stored in ./Domain/Components//model
Shared models are used between components and stored in ./Domain/common/models/*.

syntax/bella-persistance.html.title: Persist Data
syntax/bella-persistance.html.body:
Persistance
Data
Bella stores all data in memory. You don't need to worry about updating your data, Bella does it for you under the hood.
Settings
setting HelloWorldDefault:String = "Hello World!"

Control Flow
ForEach
 foreach  in 
        

If
if

    <>

if(, , )

syntax/bella-formulas.html.title: Formulas
syntax/bella-formulas.html.body:
Formulas [bella.core.formulas]
formula (, ...): = new (
  . = 
)

Example:
formula ToPlainText(Address):String = Address.street + " " +
  Address.houseNumber + Address.extension + ", " +
  Address.zip + ", " + Address.city

Share formulas
Formulas could be shared if you put them in ./Domain/common/* folder.

kompass.html.title: Kompass
kompass.html.body:
Kompass
Kompass is proprietary Message Broker integrated in Bella to facilitate asynchronous messaging between components. (fire-and-forget type of communication pattern)
Kompass could work over RBMQ or MSMQ.
